text: Nathaniel Dwayne Hale (August 19, 1969 â€“ March 15, 2011), known professionally as Nate Dogg, was an American singer, songwriter and rapper. He worked with a wide range of musicians including Snoop Dogg, Eminem, Mariah Carey and Warren G. ==Health problems== On December 19, 2007, he had a stroke. In September 2008, he suffered another stroke. ==Death== He died on March 15, 2011 from complications from multiple strokes. ==Discography== ===Studio albums=== Nate Dogg made 3 studio albums during his career: Year Single 1998 G-Funk Classics, Vol. 1 & 2 2001 Music and Me 2003 Nate Dogg ==References== Category:African- American musicians Category:American people convicted of assault Category:Rappers from California Category:Rappers from Mississippi Category:American R&B; musicians Category:Deaths from stroke Category:Musicians from Long Beach, California Category:Singers from Long Beach, California Category:1969 births Category:2011 deaths Category:African- American rappers
title: Nate Dogg
